CatDescriptText: Mr. William L. Tywmon, janitor, Sharpsburg and Mr. Donald Charley, desk clerk, Hill, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 31, 1962, pg. A3 with question: "Should relief payments to unemployed persons be increased?"  Mr. Tywmon's answer reads: "A lot must be taken into consideration, but I don't think they're adequate right now.  They should be increased."  Mr. Charley's answer reads: "Yes, please.  Everything is so high."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of William L. Twymon wearing tweed coat, plaid button down collared shirt, eyeglasses, and hat, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Donald Charley wearing dark knitted button down sweater and cap, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
